definitions.definition: able to move quickly and easily

examples.text: You need nimble fingers for that job.
She was extremely nimble on her feet.

definitions.definition: able to think, react and adapt quickly

examples.text: As a comedian, she has a quick ear and a nimble mind.
The company has been outsmarted by more nimble competitors.

wordOrigin: Old English nǣmel ‘quick to seize or comprehend’, related to niman ‘take’, of Germanic origin. The -b- was added for ease of pronunciation.
